item.title: Active Clearance Control (ACC) Cooling System Valves (PW) – Low Pressure Turbine ACC Valves

remarks.para: One may be inoperative provided valve is verified open.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "(L) (R) LPT CASE COOLING AIR VALVE INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Active Clearance Control Cooling System – Low Pressure Turbine ACC Valves

note.para: If either cooling air valve fails to move to failsafe when commanded, the EICAS status MSG "L(R) ENG CASE COOL" will be displayed. The specific valve affected will be identified by the EPCS display. EPCS message displaying "HCC/EEC" will indicate a problem with the HPC and HPT Case Cooling Air Valve. EPCS message displaying "LCC/EEC" will indicate a problem with the LPT Case Cooling Air Valve.

numlitem.para: Open fan duct cowl and thrust reverser left half (Ref. MM 78-31-00).
Check position indicators of both valves to verify valve position (see following illustration).
Verify Low Pressure Turbine Cooling Air Valve indicates "OPEN". The aircraft may be dispatched with LPT Case Cooling Air Valve in fully "OPEN" position only. Use MEL reference 75-24-1-1 for dispatch.
Dispatch is NOT allowed with the LPT Case Cooling Air Valve failed closed or partially closed.
IF the LPT Case Cooling Air Valve fails open, P&W recommends the valve be replaced as soon as practical to reduce the loss of performance due to seal rubbing.

Verify High Pressure Compressor/High Pressure Turbine Case Cooling Air Valve indicates "CLOSED". The aircraft may be dispatched with the HPC/HPT Case Cooling Air Valve in the fully "CLOSED" position. Use MEL reference 75-24-1-2 for dispatch.
Disconnect, cap and stow electrical connector of affected valve.
Close fan duct cowl and thrust reverser left half (Ref. MM 78-31-00).
